intro: Microseris douglasii var. platycarpha, commonly known as the flat-lobed biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant features basal rosettes of silver-gray, woolly leaves and produces yellow flowers in early spring. Its seeds are small and contained within slender, cylindrical pods. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
